abstract: Disclosure advocates say it is not easy enough to use the companies’ Web sites to find out which doctors are getting the most money.
snippet: Disclosure advocates say it is not easy enough to use the companies’ Web sites to find out which doctors are getting the most money.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer recently became the latest big drug maker to start disclosing payments to doctors who act as consultants or speakers. But many followers of the pharmaceutical industry are still finding it far too difficult to follow the money.

headline.main: Data on Fees to Doctors Is Called Hard to Parse
headline.print_headline: Drug Makers Reveal Payments to Doctors, but Data Isn’t Easy to Parse
